description.narrative: The year 2017 is so called transition year as FELM's program for development cooperation was originally planned for the years 2011-2016. With this application FELM is applying one year's funding for the extention program. The new development cooperation pr ogram will be designed for the years 2017-2021. The goals of FELM's development cooperation are the reduction of poverty and the realisation of human rights in a way that respects and forsters the environment. Cross-cutting themes are gender equality reali sation of rights of persons with disabilities HIV/AIDS environmental impacts and capacity building. FELM partners bilaterally with local CSOs international and domestic networks. The target groups are marginalized groups and people living in extreme povert y and the activities aim at their human rights apply. Most central target groups are women and girls people with disabilities ethnic and linguistic minorities and indigenous people as well as socially discriminated groups (e.g. dalits in Nepal). As means o f cooperation FELM does bilateral cooperation advocacy and capacity building. The results are followed and reported annually. As per FELM's analyses the context in cooperation countries will not change drastically and FELM's development objectives are in l ine with challenges in cooperation countries. Also partner organisations remain the same and no new projects are started in 2017. As per FELM's communication and global education plan the higlighted theme is women as peacemakers. In addition to that FELM w ill continue informing the great public and decision makers about the rights of people with disability as well as informing about the results of FELM's development cooperation programme. FELM will start a program for reducing carbon-dioxide footprint aimin g at 25% reduction by the end of year 2022.
